comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: According to this source: James Kennedy Moffitt house, 86 Sea View, Piedmont. Architect: Willis Polk. The house on Sea View was built for James Kennedy Moffitt by Willis Polk in 1912 and the gardens, I believe, were designed by [William Hammond] Hall, who laid out the gardens for Golden Gate Park. Moffit choose the address '86' because it was the year he graduated from Cal Berkeley (Mario Palestini, personal communication). For many years J. K. Moffitt was president of Crocker Bank and served as a U.C. Berkeley regent. A great book collector, he left the first large bequest to the Bancroft library ($100,000). www.verlang.com/sfbay0004ref_wp_5.html Got $5,150,000 to spare? Get it for yourself~ www.realtor.com/realestateandhomes-detail/86-Sea-View-Ave...
